alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Washington (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 5:18PM CDT until March 31 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Crawford County in east central Missouri... Northwestern Washington County in east central Missouri... Southeastern Franklin County in east central Missouri... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 518 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Bourbon, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Miramiguoa Park around 530 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include St. Clair, Parkway and Lonedell. This also includes Robertsville State Park and Meramec State Park. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 225 and 242, and near exit 257. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
